DisplayString.Description: A connection attempt failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time, or established connection failed because connected host has failed to respond.

DisplayString.Name: Connection Timeout
DisplayString.Description: This monitor type monitors for timeouts when attempting to connect to a port.

DisplayString.Name: Connection Refused
DisplayString.Description: This monitor type monitors being forcibly closed when attempting to connect to a port.

DisplayString.Name: DNS Resolution Failure
DisplayString.Description: This monitor type monitors any DNS resolution failure when attempting to connect to a port.

DisplayString.Name: Host Unreachable
DisplayString.Description: This monitor type monitors not being able to connect to a port.

DisplayString.Name: Service Health Roll-up for component Internet PMU
DisplayString.Description: The health of this service is determined by the health of its components. This monitor rolls up health from a particular component to the serivce.

DisplayString.Name: Distributed Application Membership Discovery
DisplayString.Description: This discovery will find which Components are members of this Distributed Application.

DisplayString.Name: Component Membership Discovery
DisplayString.Description: This discovery will find which Objects are members of this Component.

DisplayString.Name: Component Group Health Roll-up for type Object
DisplayString.Description: The health of this Component is determined by the health of its members. This monitor rolls up health from each of the members of this Component.

section.maml:title: Summary
section.maml:para: Connecting to the target part timed out.

section.maml:title: Causes
section.maml:para: This can happen for a few reasons:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The target computer is offline
There is a firewall between the watcher node and the target IP or device
IPSec is required between the watcher node and the target IP or device
The target IP:Port is actually not available

section.maml:title: Resolutions
section.maml:para: Try the following troubleshooting steps to attempt to fix the problem

maml:listItem.maml:para: Ping the target computer to ensure it's on the network
Telnet to the target IP:Port
Where x.x.x.x. is the IP Address or device name and #### is the target port number.

section.maml:title: Summary
section.maml:para: Could not resolve the name supplied name through the watcher nodes Domain Name Service.

section.maml:title: Causes
section.maml:para: This can happen for a few reasons:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The DNS client side cache has a stale entry
The DNS infrastructure not available
The watcher node DNS settings are out of date or incorrect
DNS has a stale entry for the supplied target name and is returning the wrong IP address

section.maml:title: Resolutions
section.maml:para: Try the following troubleshooting steps to attempt to fix the problem

maml:listItem.maml:para: On a Windows Computer, at the command line type:
ipconfig /flushdns
Then type:
ipconfig /registerdns
Check with your network or domain administrator if there is any problems with the DNS infrastructure that the watcher node is configured to use.
Check the IP Address that is being returned to ensure it is returning the actual device name you expect.
Do this by pinging by the device name you supplied in the wizard. Next take the IP Address and type ping -a [IPAddress]. For example, if the IP Address is 10.10.1.1:
If the name returned is different than the name supplied in the wizard there are likely some name resolution issues related to having a misconfigured or stale DNS entry.

section.maml:title: Summary
section.maml:para: The target IP or device could not be reached

section.maml:title: Causes
section.maml:para: This can happen for a few reasons:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The target computer is offline
The watcher node doesn't have the appropriate permissions
There may be a firewall between the watcher node and the target device

section.maml:title: Resolutions
section.maml:para: Try the following troubleshooting steps to attempt to fix the problem

maml:listItem.maml:para: Ping the target computer to ensure it's on the network
Ensure that the Run As account used by the watcher node has the appropriate permissions to the target data source
Check if the Windows Firewall is enabled on either the target machine or the watcher node. If it is, create an exclusion for the application you are monitoring.

section.maml:title: Causes
section.maml:para: This can happen for a few reasons:

maml:listItem.maml:para: The watcher node doesn't have the appropriate permissions

section.maml:title: Resolutions
section.maml:para: Try the following troubleshooting steps to attempt to fix the problem

maml:listItem.maml:para: Ensure that if IPSec is configured, that the machine can establish an IPSec connection
Telnet to the target IP:Port
Where x.x.x.x. is the IP Address or device name and #### is the target port number.
